pullRequest.title: Cleanup ZkOrphanTasks only when leader assignment is successful and fix CoordinatorEventBlockingQueue to handle duplicate events with metadata.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Cleanup ZkOrphanTasks only when leader assignment is successful and fix Coordinator queue to handle duplicate events with metadata.
We added an initial fix to have a new event LEADER_DO_CLEANUP_POST_ELECTION which gets called once after becoming leader. But, the cleanup is dependent on successful completion of LEADER_DO_ASSIGNMENT. If LEADER_DO_ASSIGNMENT fails, LEADER_DO_ASSIGNMENT is added again to the Queue. we have no means to remove LEADER_DO_CLEANUP_POST_ELECTION this from the queue, since the ordering is important. PR685.
To accomplish this, we will use eventMetadata in CoordinatorEvent to set cleanup to true when coordinator becomes leader and perform cleanup on successful finish of LEADER_DO_ASSIGNMENT.
We also need to fix CoordinatorEventBlockingQueue which allows duplicate entries for Events with metadata. To accomplish this, implementing equals and hashcode in CoordinatorEvent. Now, we will not allow duplicate entries for events with metadata.PR632. There was a discussion in PR632 to have long-term fix for this. Adding it as part of this PR as well.

commit.message:
Merge pull request #1 from linkedin/master

Pull latest
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:linkedin/brooklin into ZkFix
Cleanup ZkOrphanTasks only when leader assignment is successful and fix CoordinatorEventBlockingQueue

nodes.bodyText: _eventMetadata could be null for some events. I suggest comparing them with Objects.equals().

Would it be a good idea to document the purpose of cleanUpOrphanConnectorTasks?
e.g.
   * @param cleanUpOrphanConnectorTasks indicates whether the leader should clean up stale/orphan connector
   *                                    task entries in ZooKeeper
Objects.equals()? It's not clear to me if _errorMessage can never be null.
stale comment? javadoc on function seems stale, too

Since put() permits null to be inserted into _eventSet, shouldn't we move this outside of the if block?
A quick look didn't show me any places where we explicitly put(null) but I see this method returning null on line 70 and I am not 100% sure some piece of code won't put that back.
Thinking out loud: should we assert on the total number of events actually in the queue after these puts, or whether our takes exhaust them?

I almost reached out to you then thought this would prolly be a lot more useful to ask over here for knowledge sharing and wider visibility (think of future maintainers):

Why could put() be invoked with duplicate events?
Why are we rejecting duplicates?

May just be a good idea to call out why this should only be called once -> that it's an expensive operation.
Someone reading this code later may not realize why without making it explicit.
can we rename this function now, since there is no longer a "CLEANUP_TASK_POST_ELECTION" event?
It'll be good to explain what this parameter does
